River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to the hybrid fantasy world that director Lee Tamahori has created: part New Zealand, part Kenya. The costumes and production design are dazzling to the eye. But the narrative is light on training, and laughably simplistic, especially for what is trying to be an epic political "crime" story.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert.
